transcript.title: PM 69/1965 - Air Force Commemoration Week
transcript.content:
Â P. M. No. 69/ 1965

The Commonwealth Government will be representedÂ at the following functions during Air Force Commemoration Â Week,Â 12th to 19th September, 1965

BrisbaneÂ 

Sunday, 12th September

  • St. John's Anglican Cathedral Â - Senator DameÂ Annabelle Rankin, D. B. E.
  • St. Stephen's Roman Catholic Cathedral Â - Mr. K. M. K.Cairns, M. P.
  • St. Andrew's Presbyterian Church Â - The Hon. C. E.Â Barnes, Minister of State for Territories.
  • Albert Street Methodist Church - Mr. F. J. Killen, M. P.
  • City Tabernacle Baptist Church - Â Mr. E. N. Drury, M. P.

Â Wednesday, 15th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremonyÂ at the Shrine of Remembrance Air Vice-MarshalÂ I. D. McLachlan, C.B.E , D.F. C.

Canberra

Wednesday, 15 th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremony at the Stone of Remembrance,Â Australian War Memorial The Hon. Peter Howson,Minister of State for Air.

Â 

Sydney

Wednesday, 15 th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremony at the Cenotaph The Hon.Â W. McMahon, Minister of State for Labour andÂ National Service.

Â 

Melbourne

Sunday. 12th September

  • St. Paul's AnglicanÂ Cathedral The Hon. H. F. Opperman, M. P.,Â Minister of State for Immigration.

Wednesday, 15th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremonyÂ at the Shrine of Remembrance Mr. E. M. C. Fox, M. P.

Thursday, 16th September

  • Official dinner at theÂ Air Forces Memorial Centre The Hon. B. M. Snedden,Â Attorney-General.

Sunday. 19th September

  • St. Patrick's RomanÂ Catholic Cathedral Senator Ivy Wedgwood.

Â 

Hobart

Wednesday, 15th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremonyÂ at the Cenotaph Air Commodore D. W. Kingwell, D. S. O.

Â 

Adelaide

Wednesday, 15th September

  • Wreath-laying ceremonyÂ at the South Australian National War MemorialÂ Air Vice-Marshal E. Hey, C. B. E.

CANBERRA
10 September, 1965.
